newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: SLOVAK C.BANK SAYS NO REV REPO TENDER ON TUESDAY.
newsitem.headline: SLOVAK C.BANK SAYS NO REV REPO TENDER ON TUESDAY.

text.p: The National Bank of Slovakia (NBS) said it would not hold a tender for short-term securities repurchase or reverse repurchase on Tuesday.
According to official NBS figures, the banking sector is in a liquidity surplus, with banks' minimum reserve demands fulfilled at 104.62 percent as of Monday.
On Monday, the NBS drained funds totalling 2.9 billion crowns through a reverse repo tender for seven-day securities, with the average rate falling to 13.26 percent from 14.65 percent.
